entry.title: Introduction to Analysics Ⅰ Course
entry.content:
About the course

This course is part of the Analysics course and is a reference course for the entrance examination of the Graduate School of Mathematical Informatics at the University of Tokyo .

This course is a general introduction to Mathematical Analysis I, with selected materials that are profound and advanced, covering topics such as Real Analysis, Measure Theory, and Topology.

Course and Book

The following are the main course and book used in this course.

Books：

Real Analysis (Halsey L. RoydenPatrick M. Fitzpatrick)

数学分析中的典型问题与方法 第3版 (裴礼文)

数学分析讲义（第一册）陈天权

Course:

数学分析：一元微积分

References

W. Rudin: Principles of Mathematical Analysis

数学分析之课程讲义（清华丘班）

Amann.Analysis Ⅰ

Amann.Analysis Ⅱ

杉浦光夫.解析入門 Ⅰ

杉浦光夫.解析入門 Ⅱ

新しい微積分〈上〉

新しい微積分〈下〉

entry.title: Introduction to Basic Physics Ⅰ Course
entry.content:
Background

Why do I need to learn Physics?

Actually, my undergraduate major has little to do with physics. Although it is an engineering discipline, it does not require studying physics in college. However, since there may be a significant connection with physics when pursuing a graduate degree in the future, and physics is actually the subject that I first encountered, I decided to learn it.

An Introduction to this Course.

Due to my almost forgotten high school physics knowledge and the fact that I did not study physics during my freshman year, I chose to start with some simple courses and books.

Course and Book

The following are the main course and book used in this course.

Books：R. Shankar.Fundamentals of Physics I

Course:Fundamentals of Physics I.Open Yale Courses .
Also you can find it in BiliBili

References

Mechanics(L. D. Landau, E. M. Lifshitz )

The Feynman Lectures on Physics, Vol. I The New Millennium Edition (Richard P. Feynman)

entry.title: BAⅡ-2.3不变子空间与特征向量

entry.content:
About the course

This course is part of the Algebra course and is a reference course for the entrance examination of the Graduate School of Mathematical Informatics at the University of Tokyo .

This course is a general introduction to Linear Algebra and Advenced Algebra in China.
